intro: Dyschoriste nudanthera, commonly known as the naked anther plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dyschoriste nudanthera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
